intro: Everardia recurvigluma, commonly known as the narrow-leaf everardia, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release small, winged seeds. Everardia recurvigluma is typically found in moist, shaded environments in tropical regions.
